data.title: Culling causes partial clipping of ui::Button if part is outside screen
data.body: With Culling enabled there is an issue with some Buttons after a change in margin. It appears that if margin is set to -10 just after button create we get partial Button "clipping" if we later update the margin to >= 0. While we could change how we position the buttons and which widgets we use the issue arises when we have a VBox with Button as children and we change the margins from -20 to 0 in order to make the buttons only partially visible. Notes: - I have no idea yet if clipping is the culprit, but the issue goes away when we disable CULLING - unsure if it's clipping, Scale9Sprite draw path, or something else? ## Example This is a screen shot after we have moved the two top buttons setting initially with -20 Left Margin and later updating the Left Margin to 0. We have also tried to add a call to `updateSizeAndPosition();` with no change. (sorry, the screen shots have 10 pixels of the xcode window behind the game) Culling OFF (Desired/Good) Culling ON (Wrong/Bad)

data.title: Cocos can't compile Android with APP_STL := c++_static
data.body:
Using the Cocos app and prebuilt libraries,  it fails to compile for Android if using `APP_STL := c++_static` in /proj.android/jni/Application.mk

But if we don't use prebuilt libraries it compiles fine.

data.title: Adding COCOS_CONSOLE_ROOT environment variable fails with zsh on OSX 10.10.4
data.body:
On OSX 10.10.4, using zsh with Zach Holman's [dotfiles](https://github.com/holman/dotfiles), running `./setup.py` returns this error:

```
2.2.2 in cocos2d-x/ on v3
â€º ./setup.py

Setting up cocos2d-x...
->Check environment variable COCOS_CONSOLE_ROOT
  ->Search for environment variable COCOS_CONSOLE_ROOT...
    ->COCOS_CONSOLE_ROOT not found

  -> Add COCOS_CONSOLE_ROOT environment variable...
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./setup.py", line 707, in <module>
    opts.ndk_root, opts.android_sdk_root, opts.ant_root)
  File "./setup.py", line 665, in set_environment_variables
    self.set_console_root()
  File "./setup.py", line 473, in set_console_root
    COCOS_CONSOLE_ROOT, cocos_consle_root)
  File "./setup.py", line 206, in _set_environment_variable
    ret = self._set_environment_variable_unix(key, value)
  File "./setup.py", line 186, in _set_environment_variable_unix
    shutil.copy(self.file_used_for_setup, self.backup_file)
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/shutil.py", line 119, in copy
    copyfile(src, dst)
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/shutil.py", line 83, in copyfile
    with open(dst, 'wb') as fdst:
IOError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/Users/Rpaz/.zshrc.backup'
```

I tried running `touch ~/.zshrc.backup`, but it just gives me `touch: /Users/Rpaz/.zshrc.backup: No such file or directory`. `touch ~/.zshrc.backupa` works fine, though, which is kind of bizarre.

data.title: In CSLoader.cpp, change log level of a couple log messages or remove them altogether
Fix/Optimisation of TextReader
data.body:
If a long piece of text is defined in cocosStudio with a custom font, TextReader will unnecessarily (and implicitly) build the label with the default system font first. It will also trigger repeat recalculations of the label's size, atlas and system font texture via the setFontName() and setFontSize() calls.

By setting the text content last we can drastically minimise this overhead.

Furthermore if the text content is large the system font renderer will potentially produce a texture wider than the maximum texture size of the device. This is avoided with the given change for custom fonts but will still pose an issue for large labels relying on the default system font.

data.title: v3.8beta0 EventListenerTouchAllAtOnce events triggered for each camera (performance issue)
data.body:
There does not seem to be a practical reason to cycle through all cameras to dispatch EventDispatcher::dispatchTouchEventToListeners events.

Calling it once per camera seems to be unnecessary and inefficient.

Is there a reason for sending the event once per camera that I am missing?

EventDispatcher::dispatchTouchEventToListeners is cycling through all cameras on line 834 of CCEventDispatcher.cpp of Cocos2d-x 3.8 beta 0.

If you move a camera around or move/scale a node that is masked to a camera, there is no touch coordinate space translation or scale. The touch coordinates are always scaled and cropped per the design resolution settings and can be defined as VisibleRect.

```
Size visibleSize = Director::getInstance()->getVisibleSize();
Vec2 origin = Director::getInstance()->getVisibleOrigin();
_visibleRect = Rect(origin, visibleSize);
```

Example code to see this can be found here: https://github.com/jimrange/cocos2d-x-bugs/tree/designRes

e.g. on an iPhone 5, the touch space with the default no border policy in the HelloWorld results in a touch rect of: visibleRect:0.00,25.07,480.00,269.87.

So if I add 2 cameras to my game, e.g. parallax camera, game world camera, and use the default camera for the HUD, then I get three calls to the HUD's EventDispatcher::dispatchTouchEventToListeners  listener for each event.
e.g. Start a touch by pressing the screen and you will get three calls to onTouchesBegan, all with the identical coordinates.
onTouchesBegan
onTouchesBegan
onTouchesBegan
